description:
In this detailed blog post, we will explore what openSUSE Aeon is and how it benefits lazy developers to get things done efficiently.

The post openSUSE Aeon: A Lazy Developer’s Dream OS appeared first on Linux Today.
title: openSUSE Aeon: A Lazy Developer’s Dream OS

description:
RansomLord is an open-source tool that automates the creation of PE files, which are used to exploit ransomware pre-encryption.

The post RansomLord: Open-Source Anti-Ransomware Exploit Tool appeared first on Linux Today.
title: RansomLord: Open-Source Anti-Ransomware Exploit Tool

description:
When it comes to web development, there is a fairly small range of Scala frameworks to choose from. The choice depends on finding the right tool for the job at hand. Here’s our pick of the finest Scala web frameworks.

The post 6 Top Free and Open-Source Scala Web Frameworks appeared first on Linux Today.
title: 6 Top Free and Open-Source Scala Web Frameworks

description:
Discover a step-by-step guide to installing Sublime Text 4 on Ubuntu and other Linux distributions, then the usage of package control.

The post How to Install Sublime Text on Ubuntu (and Other Linux Distros) appeared first on Linux Today.
title: How to Install Sublime Text on Ubuntu (and Other Linux Distros)

description:
Crystal Dock is a cool desktop panel with a parabolic zooming effect for KDE Plasma 6. While visually inspired by Mac OS X’s Dock, it aims to follow the traditional Linux model of a desktop panel.

The post Crystal Dock: Dock (Desktop Panel) for the Linux Desktop appeared first on Linux Today.
title: Crystal Dock: Dock (Desktop Panel) for the Linux Desktop

description:
Void Linux is a distribution that’s designed to be lightweight, secure, and easy to use. It is an independent distribution and not based on Debian or Fedora Linux. Here’s a simple step-by-step tutorial on how to install Void Linux on physical and virtual machines.

The post How to Install Void Linux [Step by Step] appeared first on Linux Today.
title: How to Install Void Linux [Step by Step]

description:
On National FreeBSD Day, we honor the open-source OS, a tech cornerstone since 1993. Happy 31st Birthday, FreeBSD!

The post Happy 31st Birthday, FreeBSD! appeared first on Linux Today.
title: Happy 31st Birthday, FreeBSD!

description:
Facing CentOS 7 end-of-life? SUSE provides a lifeline with a Liberty Linux Lite subscription, ensuring the OS stays secure beyond June 30, 2024.

The post SUSE Liberty Linux Lite Extends CentOS 7’s Life to 2028 appeared first on Linux Today.
title: SUSE Liberty Linux Lite Extends CentOS 7’s Life to 2028

description:
Fedora 40, the latest release of the popular Linux distribution, provides multiple methods to change the time zone, ensuring a hassle-free experience for users. In this comprehensive guide, we’ll explore these methods in detail, empowering you to effortlessly adjust your system’s time zone to match your geographical location.

The post How to Change TimeZone on Fedora 40 appeared first on Linux Today.
title: How to Change TimeZone on Fedora 40

description:
Google Charts lets users visualize data on their website. It offers a wide range of ready-to-use chart types. The most common way to use Google Charts is with JavaScript that’s embedded in a web page. The software is proprietary. Here’s our verdict on some great free and open-source alternatives to Google Charts.

The post Best Free and Open-Source Alternatives to Google Charts appeared first on Linux Today.
title: Best Free and Open-Source Alternatives to Google Charts
